results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel
00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, Maria Savarino, Ayen Guinto, Krystal Webb, Marten McEachran, Samantha Sharp, Laura O'Donnell, Chris Villarroel, Dean Sacco, Charles Skoutariotis, Katherine O'Neill, Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.
results.title_for_label: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Young, Maria Savarino, Ayen Guinto, Krystal Webb, Marten McEachran, Samantha Sharp, Laura O’Donnell, Chris Villarroel, Dean Sacco, Charles Skoutariotis, Katherine O’Neill, Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Where I'm supposed to be...
results.creator_credit: Katherine O'Neill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Katherine O’Neill celebrates her first passion, the place where she can be who she is, the place that inspires her and feeds her creativity.

results.title: The Unpredictability of life...
results.creator_credit: Chris Villarroel, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Chris Villarroel’s family were falling apart his home became his hell and he had no one to talk to. Eventually, Villarroel found solace and happiness in a new family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Villarroel, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Chris Villarroel’s family were falling apart his home became his hell and he had no one to talk to. Eventually, Villarroel found solace and happiness in a new family.

results.title: Under cover
results.creator_credit: Marten McEachran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marten McEachran might be a normal schoolkid, but he also leads another, secret life. These lives co-exist happily and McEachran recognises that it is both lives that make him who he is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marten McEachran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A True friend
results.creator_credit: Laura O'Donnell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: If Laura O’Donnell could give out an award for Best Friend, her neighbour Bree would get it. The share a close bond, despite differences and going to seperate schools. O’Donnell celebrates their friendship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laura O’Donnell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: If Laura O’Donnell could give out an award for Best Friend, her neighbour Bree would get it. The share a close bond, despite differences and going to seperate schools. O’Donnell celebrates their friendship.

results.title: Trench coat man
results.creator_credit: Charles Skoutariotis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Charles Skoutariotis talks about the events in his life, the little things, that led him to become the person he is. At school, they call him ‘Trench coat man’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Skoutariotis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My neice
results.creator_credit: Samantha Sharp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Samantha Sharp may have become an aunty early in her life but she’s glad she is. She plays with her niece in the way that older aunts couldn’t and she cherishes the time they spend together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samantha Sharp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Samantha Sharp may have become an aunty early in her life but she’s glad she is. She plays with her niece in the way that older aunts couldn’t and she cherishes the time they spend together.

results.title: The Most important question in the world
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paul Young went to university, he knew he didn’t want to be a teacher. However, over time, he has seen the value of the profession and learnt that it’s not about the content, it’s about the life lessons.
results.title_for_label: The Most important question in the world
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Paul Young went to university, he knew he didn’t want to be a teacher. However, over time, he has seen the value of the profession and learnt that it’s not about the content, it’s about the life lessons.
description_for_label: When Paul Young went to university, he knew he didn’t want to be a teacher. However, over time, he has seen the value of the profession and learnt that it’s not about the content, it’s about the life lessons.

results.title: Insert name here
results.creator_credit: Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When his James’ parents bought him a drum kit, Troy Maguire and his friends decided to start a band. Now they just need a name, a few songs and a gig.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
